intro: Asparagus africanus var. pubescens, commonly known as the African asparagus, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring woody stems and dense clusters of small, needle-like leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in raceme inflorescences, which are followed by small, red berries containing the seeds. Its foliage is characterized by a fine, pubescent texture, giving it the variety name *pubescens*. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
